trivia.question: What's the capital of Canada?
What Canadian airport was renamed for Pierre Trudeau?
Built by industrialist Henry Kaiser, the Grand Coulee Dam creates a reservoir called Franklin Delano Roosevelt Lake on what river in Washington State?
Where would you use some rands to get into Kruger National Park, home to 140 mammal species?
If you're taking a boat ride with Charon, where are you going?
Although Switzerland wasn't a UN member until 2002, which Swiss city has been the HQ for such UN agencies as the World Health Organization and the International Labor Organization?
Named for a 19th-century feminist, what does the Lucy Stone League promote?
trivia.ans: Not changing your name when you marry

trivia.question: The Vespa motor scooter was named for its resemblance to what creature?
Seventeen years after her photo was taken by Steve McCurry in 1985, the greeneyed Afghan girl was discovered to be Sharbat Gula. On what magazine's cover did her photo appear?
If you wear a green star, you are indicating that you speak what language?
Their name notwithstanding, what is the largest member of the Delphinidae (dolphin) family?
What hair care product was named for the Massachusetts firefighter who hoped it would reverse his baldness?
Only two months have two US federal holidays each. What are they?
Triple-murderer Thomas James Holden topped what organization's first mostwanted list, which was issued on March 14, 1950?
Who is the only US president to resign from office?
What is the name of the clock-like device that musicians use to measure time?
Hydrogen is the most abundant element in the universe. What is the second?
In geometry, how many sides does a "nonagon" have?
Cult leader of "The People's Temple," who convinced hundreds of his followers to commit suicide in Guyana in 1978?
At 3.86 miles squared, Imrali is the smallest island in the Mediterranean Sea. What is the largest?
What Austrian neurologist is considered the founding father of psychoanalysis?
Originally a member of the band "The Police," which rock star was born Gordon Sumner?
Which 1968 musical film stars Dick Van Dyke as Caractacus Potts and Sally Ann Howes as Truly Scrumptious?
If while vacationing in Italy, you were served a dish named "Pesce Spada", what would you be eating?
Which capital city was originally founded by Pedro De Valdivia after he defeated a large force of Indians on the banks of the Rio Mapocho in 1541?
Written sometime around 1500, which Shakespearean comedy is set in the "Forest Of Arden"?
According to his song "American Pie", what type of car did Don Mclean drive to the levy?
Based in Sunrise, Florida, what sport is played by the Florida Panthers?
Featured in the 1986 movie "Top Gun", who recorded the song "Danger Zone"?
Who played the role of the extremely naive and guileless assistant bartender Woody Boyd on the TV sitcom "Cheers"?
Believed to be the god of rain, which of the following is one of the most famous dragons in Chinese mythology?
One of music's earliest superstars, what nationality was the romantic-era composer Frederic Chopin?
Located in Japan, what is the first city in history to have an atomic bomb dropped onto it?
Released in 1988, who is the main actor in the romantic drama film "Cocktail"?
Who is generally credited with inventing the hot-air balloon?
The fourth astrological sign, what star sign has a crab for its symbol?
How many lanes does a standard Olympic swimming pool have?
Which fast-food restaurant chain was established by Ray Kroc?
Born in the Shakya Republic, by what other name is Siddartha Gautama known?
Where was the Italian explorer, navigator and colonizer, Christopher Columbus born?
Home to over a hundred statues, monuments and fountains, where are the Luxembourg Gardens?
Alfred Hitchcock was nominated for a Best Director Oscar five times in his career. How many Oscars did he win?
Released in October 2002, which American rock band had a huge hit with the song "When I'm Gone"?
In what language does "obrigado" mean "thank you"?
As a result of the "Case-Church Amendment" passed by the U.S. Congress, direct U.S. military involvement in the Vietnam War ended in what year?
Which country won gold in the sport of ice hockey at the 2014 Winter Olympic Games?
Which strait can be found between the North and South islands of New Zealand?
Written and directed by Michael Mann, who stars as Lt. Vincent Hanna in the 1995 film "Heat"?
Published in 1977, who wrote the best-selling novel "The Thorn Birds"?
What is the capital of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam?
Old-time film actress Yvonne de Carlo played which role in the Munsters TV series?
Michael Nesmith was a member of which 1960s pop group?
Based on a novel by Stephen King, which Stanley Kubrick film starred Jack Nicholson?
Possibly dating back to ancient Mesopotamia, which dessert consists of thin layers of filo pastry filled with nuts and honey?
What is the British English word for a truck?
In which American cartoon series would you find the characters Kenny McCormick and Stan Marsh?
Who was the youngest member of the Beatles?
What is the colour of the ball worth five points in a game of snooker?
In which country is the port of Busan?
Which Canadian comedian teamed with Dan Aykroyd to form the Blues Brothers?
The 1952 Winter Olympic Games were held in which city?
Which of the following songs was recorded by Elvis Presley?
trivia.alt3: (Sittin' on) The Dock of the Bay

trivia.question: How many primary apostles did Jesus have?

For two players, which of the following games is played on a 10×10 square board with 40 game pieces per side?
To bake a basic loaf of homemade bread, you would require flour, water, salt and what other essential ingredient?
Which country was the first to put a man in space?
Which of the following auto parts is part of an automobile's ignition system?
On which continent is the country of Afghanistan located?
Pochard, Pintail and Shoveler are all varieties of which animal?

On the popular fantasy drama "The Game of Thrones," who plays the role of Tyrion Lannistern?
Seen a lot in the news as of late, Kiev is the capital of what country?
Whom did John Bellingham assassinate by shooting them in the heart?
Which organ secretes insulin?
trivia.alt3:
Lungs
General A vehicle capable of travelling over land, water and many other land surfaces, who invented the hovercraft? Christopher Cockerell George Ballas Thomas Edison Roger Bacon

General On the animated TV sitcom the Simpsons, how many children do the Simpsons have? 3 7 1 5

General Which of the following letters cannot be found in any of the 50 U.S. state names? Q X Z W
General What famous event took place at a farm owned by Max Yasgur? Woodstock First flight of Wright Brothers The last duel in the United States The first Pony Express
General How many colors were in the very first box of Crayola crayons? 8 20 12 24

General Which city is home to the Maple Leaf's hockey team? Toronto Ottawa Calgary Vancouver
General According to the Chinese Zodiac, what year is 2014? The horse The dragon The monkey The snake

General Which politician was caught fooling around on a boat ironically named "The Monkey Business" in 1987? Gary Hart Gerry Studds Brock Adams Bill Clinton

General Which ocean ranks as the smallest in size? Arctic Pacific Indian Atlantic

General The rapper Eminem appeared in which of these films? 8 mile Lethal Weapon The Green Mile Slapshot

General In the game of golf, what is the correct term for one under par? Birdie Duck Falcon Eagle

General Which of these strokes is not part of a swimming medley? Side stroke Backstroke Butterfly Breaststroke
General What is the chemical symbol for silicon? Si Su Sc S
General Which of these films is about bobsledding? Cool Runnings The Cutting Edge Mystery, Alaska The Mighty Ducks
General In the hit show "American Dad," what is the name of the Alien? Roger Bobby Mark George
General Charlie Watts and Ronnie Wood are members of which band? The Rolling Stones The Bare Naked Ladie Nickelback ACDC

General What is the proper term for a judge's hammer? Gavel Ball Peen Sledge Mallet
General What sport did Ian Thorpe compete in at the Sydney Olympics? Swimming Archery Boxing Decathlon
General Which of these famous people said, "It was a wise man who invented beer"? Plato W. C. Fields Pope John Paul I Benjamin Franklin
General Who is the heroine in the game Tomb Raider? Lara Croft Rayne Lilith Jennifer Tate
General In which country is the "Forbidden City" located? China Mexico Peru Mexico

General Spanning across the Reuss River, Chapel Bridge that is located in which nation? Switzerland Japan America England
General How many points is a game played to in badminton? 21 points 31 points 11 points 41 points
General Which of these colors makes up the flag of the Russian Federation? Red white and blue Red, yellow and blue Red and yellow Black and green
General What is the capital of Bangladesh? Dhaka Berma Oslo Caracas

General The tagline "Lie. Cheat. Steal. All in a day's work." is from which movie? Glengarry Glen Ross The Bodyguard The Pinkpanther Ocean's Eleven
General Known for his roles in the Godfather and Scarface, where was Al Pacino born? New York Vancouver London Rome
General Which city is nicknamed the "Eternal City"? Rome Paris Vienna Brussels
General Who played Carter in the film Rush Hour? Chris Tucker Robert Littman Ken Leung Jackie Chan
General How many feet are in a chain? 66 85 100 40
General A peppercorn is which part of the black pepper plant? Fruit Stem Root Flower

General Jackie Chan does the voice of which creature in the film "Kung Fu Panda"? Monkey Crane Panda Tiger
General Which nation's name translates to "Alba"? Scotland Kenya Peru Germany

The terms "drivers" and "irons" are used in which of the following sports?
How high is a basketball hoop rim above the playing floor?
Who was the first defenseman to lead the NHL in scoring?
Who is the only player in MLB history with more than 1,000 stolen bases?

Which NFL team won the very first Superbowl?
Which American swimmer won 7 gold medals at the 1972 Summer Olympics?
What sports superstar lit the flame at the 1996 Atlantic Summer Olympics?
As of 2014, who is the only pitcher in the history of the MLB to have thrown back-toback no-hitters?
Which WTA star has spent a record breaking 377 weeks as the world's number one tennis player?

Defending his world heavyweight title six times, which boxer holds the undefeated record at 49-0?

As of 2014, which NFL quarterback has played the most consecutive games at 321?

Achieved in 1941, which MLB star holds the record with a 56 game continuous hit streak?

trivia.alt3: The defeat of the Spanish Armada
